title: Why Juice is coming back to Earth
summary: ESA’s Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (Juice) returns to Earth on 19–20 August 2024, to complete the world's first Lunar-Earth gravity assist. Flight controllers will guide the spacecraft past the Moon and then Earth itself, ‘braking’ the spacecraft. This manoeuvre may seem counterintuitive but will allow Juice to take a shortcut via Venus on it's way to Jupiter.

title: Planet signs deal with NATO to supply satellite imagery
summary: The company’s satellite imagery will be used by NATO’s 'Alliance Persistent Surveillance from Space' program

title: Hubble Spots Billowing Bubbles of Stellar Floss
summary: A bubbling region of stars both old and new lies some 160,000 light-years away in the constellation Dorado. This complex cluster of emission nebulae is known as N11, and was discovered by American astronomer and NASA astronaut Karl Gordon Henize in 1956. NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope brings a new image of the cluster in the […]

title: At Work and Beyond, NASA Employees Find Joy in Aviation
summary: The first “A” in NASA stands for aeronautics. Glenn Research Center in Cleveland is just one of several NASA centers conducting revolutionary research to make flight cleaner, safer, and quieter. title: Rocket Lab-built Mars smallsats arrive at launch site
summary: A pair of smallsats built by Rocket Lab for a NASA mission to Mars have arrived in Florida for a launch this fall on the inaugural flight of Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket.
